question: What is risk management in crypto trading? A) Maximizing profits B) Minimizing losses C) Predicting market movements D) Following market trends
What is a stop-loss order in crypto trading? A) An order to buy at a specific price B) An order to sell at a specific price to limit losses C) An order to take profits D) An order to follow trends
What is leverage in crypto trading? A) Borrowing funds to increase trade size B) Reducing risk C) Following market trends D) Analyzing charts
What is a candlestick chart in crypto trading? A) A chart showing market trends B) A chart showing price movements over time C) A chart for predictions D) A chart for news
What is a bull market in crypto? A) A market with rising prices B) A market with falling prices C) A stable market D) A volatile market
What is a bear market in crypto? A) A market with rising prices B) A market with falling prices C) A stable market D) A volatile market
What is volatility in crypto trading? A) Stability in prices B) Rapid price changes C) Predictable trends D) Low liquidity
What is a crypto trading platform? A) A tool for market news B) A software for executing trades C) A market trend D) A profit tracker
What is a blockchain? A) A centralized database B) A decentralized ledger of transactions C) A type of cryptocurrency D) A trading platform
What is Bitcoin? A) A stablecoin B) A decentralized cryptocurrency C) A centralized payment system D) A type of NFT
What is Ethereum? A) A cryptocurrency exchange B) A blockchain platform with smart contracts C) A type of stablecoin D) A wallet application
What is a smart contract? A) A legally binding contract B) A self-executing code on a blockchain C) A type of cryptocurrency D) A trading algorithm
What is DeFi? A) Decentralized Finance B) Digital Fiat C) Distributed Funding D) Direct Financing
What is an NFT? A) A type of cryptocurrency B) A non-fungible token C) A trading strategy D) A blockchain protocol

What is a private key? A) A public address for receiving funds B) A secret code for accessing crypto assets C) A type of blockchain D) A trading signal

What is a gas fee? A) A fee for trading crypto B) A fee for executing transactions on a blockchain C) A fee for storing crypto D) A fee for mining
What is staking in crypto? A) Trading cryptocurrencies B) Locking tokens to support a blockchain and earn rewards C) Mining new coins D) Creating NFTs

What is a crypto order book? A) A list of buy and sell orders on an exchange B) A record of blockchain transactions C) A type of wallet D) A trading algorithm

What is a crypto liquidity pool? A) A pool of stablecoins B) A collection of tokens for trading on a DEX C) A type of wallet D) A blockchain protocol
What is a crypto hard fork? A) A minor blockchain update B) A major blockchain split creating a new chain C) A type of wallet D) A trading strategy
What is a crypto soft fork? A) A backward-compatible blockchain update B) A complete blockchain split C) A type of NFT D) A trading platform
What is a crypto token? A) A physical coin B) A digital asset on a blockchain C) A type of exchange D) A trading signal
What is a crypto burn? A) Destroying tokens to reduce supply B) A market crash C) A type of wallet D) A trading strategy
What is a crypto whale? A) A large blockchain network B) A trader with significant holdings C) A type of stablecoin D) A trading platform

What is a crypto arbitrage? A) Trading the same asset across exchanges for profit B) Staking tokens C) Mining coins D) Creating NFTs
